body: Awesome fix - look at all that fallout!

Updated with accordance to the @eefriedman 's advice and rebased.
I'm going to seat on this patch a bit more and fix another bug similar to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/28075, allowing unstable items outside of braces in imports like

```
use std::rt::{};
```

@brson This bug was discovered when we removed a gated function. With this fix, we add new breaking changes by disallowing imports of still present, unused, unstable functionality. Maybe it deserves a crater run? If the fallout is bad, maybe even a warning cycle (even if that sounds extreme).

> I'm going to seat on this patch a bit more and fix another bug similar to #28075, allowing unstable items outside of braces in imports like `use std::rt::{};`

So, fixing this issue would likely require going to librustc_resolve,  resolving the prefix and assigning `PathResolution` to it without actually importing `std::rt` in the process. I'm not familiar with resolve, so I'm just going to fill a new issue and leave it for later. Update for this PR will follow soon either.
Done.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28339) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
Rebased.
@brson Can we get a crater run?
I've scheduled crater runs.

Looks like this [has some relatively significant breakage](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/75ab63b9789652249ec2).

The cause of all the root regressions appears to be that we have an unstable `std::intrinsics` module, but stable contents (because they're reexported). It was assumed that `use std::intrinsics` would be guarded, but this bug let it slide, so all these use cases got pass the feature gater.

I would personally think, however, that we could submit PRs to update all those crates, rebuild the other non-root-regressions to make sure there's no more fallout, and then land this while publishing information about how to migrate. The breakage here may be largely limited to the `std::intrinsics` module, so it may not be that bad.

thoughts @brson?
Updated with a fix for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/28388
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28399) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
Rebased.
Yeah, let's submit PR's downstream. I can look into it tomorrow.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28349) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
Rebased.

I have submitted PRs upstream to affected crates:
- [rust-compress](https://github.com/alexcrichton/rust-compress/commit/6d940a392502f39e360bef3dc0610c4d349be9be)
- [tendril](https://github.com/servo/tendril/pull/20)
- [gfx](https://github.com/gfx-rs/gfx/pull/803)
Once those PRs have been merged/released I think we'll want to do another crater run here now that more bugs have been fixed.

@alexcrichton 
Tests updated.

Ok, a [new crater run](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4437a360058b7bbdfdf9) indicates that this has 4 root regressions, 2 of which were spurious because of timeouts and 2 of which were because libraries are depending on an older version of gfx which did not get the fix in https://github.com/gfx-rs/gfx/pull/803.

@brson, how do you feel about merging? I'm comfortable with the breakage here and I think we may want to make a post on internals and such to ensure that everyone knows about this, but I think this should be good to go.
@alexcrichton Yes, I feel ok about it. Thanks for doing the downstream work.
@bors: r+ b44cb01bd73b32ffe046b4dcfa549a954d139ab2
:hourglass: Testing commit b44cb01 with merge e9d2587...

:sunny: Test successful - [auto-linux-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-nopt-t/builds/6522), [auto-linux-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-opt/builds/6536), [auto-linux-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-nopt-t/builds/6475), [auto-linux-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-opt/builds/6500), [auto-linux-64-x-android-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-x-android-t/builds/6479), [auto-mac-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-32-opt/builds/6554), [auto-mac-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-nopt-t/builds/6549), [auto-mac-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-opt/builds/6512), [auto-win-gnu-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-32-nopt-t/builds/1499), [auto-win-gnu-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-32-opt/builds/1498), [auto-win-gnu-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-64-nopt-t/builds/1497), [auto-win-gnu-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-gnu-64-opt/builds/1499), [auto-win-msvc-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-msvc-32-opt/builds/775), [auto-win-msvc-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-msvc-64-opt/builds/1481)
